sections.title: Commitment to Data Protection
content: SmartHoster.io is fully committed to protecting the privacy, integrity, and security of personal data under its control in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR – EU Regulation 2016/679) and applicable Portuguese law (Lei n.º 58/2019).

sections.title: Lawful Basis for Processing
content: All personal data collected, processed, or stored by SmartHoster.io is handled lawfully, fairly, and transparently. Our lawful bases for processing include:
list: Contractual necessity (e.g. service agreements with property owners)
Legal obligations (e.g. guest registration via SEF/AIMA)
Legitimate interest (e.g. fraud prevention, analytics)
Consent (where applicable, especially for marketing or cookies)

sections.title: Data Collection Practices
content: We collect and process personal data only as required to operate our services. Data categories may include:
list: Identification and contact information
Financial and payment-related data
Guest registration details (as required by law)
Booking and occupancy history
Platform usage metadata
sections.additional: We limit data collection to what is strictly necessary and relevant to the purpose.

sections.title: Data Encryption & Security
content: All personal data transmitted or stored by SmartHoster.io is protected by industry-standard encryption protocols.
list: Data is encrypted in transit (via SSL/TLS) and at rest (where applicable)
Backups and servers are securely managed
Access to data is limited to authorized personnel under strict confidentiality obligations
Systems are regularly updated and monitored for vulnerabilities

sections.title: Third-Party Processors
content: SmartHoster.io engages vetted third-party service providers for technical infrastructure, booking management, automation, and communications. These providers act as data processors under GDPR and operate under formal agreements that meet regulatory standards.
Key subprocessors include (but are not limited to):
list: HostKit – calendar, reservation, and guest management platform (encrypted)
Nuki – smart lock provider (device access, PIN codes)
Stripe – payment processing (PCI DSS compliant)
Email and messaging tools – for operational communications
additional: Each subprocessor is contractually required to:
• Process data only on our documented instructions
• Comply with GDPR data protection obligations
• Notify us promptly in the event of a data breach
We retain full control over your data and monitor all third-party access closely.

sections.title: Data Subject Rights
content: Under GDPR, you have the right to:
list: Access your personal data
Request correction or deletion of inaccurate data
Object to processing or restrict certain types of use
Receive your data in a portable format
Withdraw consent at any time
Lodge a complaint with the Comissão Nacional de Proteção de Dados (CNPD)
sections.additional: To exercise these rights, contact us at: admin@smarthoster.io

sections.title: Data Retention & Minimization
content: We only retain personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill our obligations, including:
list: Legal/tax compliance (typically 10 years for invoicing)
Operational records (for active contracts)
User support and account history
Consent records for cookies and marketing (until withdrawn)
sections.additional: Where data is no longer needed, it is securely deleted or anonymized.

sections.title: Data Transfers
content: SmartHoster.io does not transfer personal data outside the European Economic Area (EEA) unless:
list: The transfer is subject to an adequacy decision (e.g. EU–US Data Privacy Framework);
Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) are in place;
The recipient has implemented appropriate safeguards.

sections.title: Breach Notification
content: In the event of a data breach affecting your personal data, we will:
list: Notify the CNPD within 72 hours (if required by law)
Inform affected individuals without undue delay
Provide full transparency, documentation, and remedial action
